meanings.def: the act or process of putting people or things into a group or class (= of classifying them)
examples: a style of music that defies classification (= is like no other)
a style of dancing that defies classification
the broad classification of music into classical and pop

meanings.def: a group, class, division, etc. into which somebody or something is put
examples: a document with the security classification ‘confidential’
The material was put into the highest security classification.
Many fairly common human behaviours can fall under the general classification of ‘mental illness’.
The classification ‘science’ covers a great many different subjects.

meanings.def: the act of putting animals, plants, etc. into groups, classes or divisions according to their characteristics
examples: The classification of bony fish is extremely complicated.

meanings.def: a system of arranging books, tapes, magazines, etc. in a library into groups according to their subject
